chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: O that thou wert as my brother, that sucked the breasts of my mother! when I should find thee without, I would kiss thee; yea, I should not be despised.
items.plainText: O that thou wert as my brother, that sucked the breasts of my mother! when I should find thee without, I would kiss thee; yea, I should not be despised.

items.text: I would lead thee, and bring thee into my mother's house, who would instruct me: I would cause thee to drink of spiced wine of the juice of my pomegranate.
items.plainText: I would lead thee, and bring thee into my mother's house, who would instruct me: I would cause thee to drink of spiced wine of the juice of my pomegranate.

items.text: His left hand should be under my head, and his right hand should embrace me.
items.plainText: His left hand should be under my head, and his right hand should embrace me.

items.text: I charge you, O daughters of Jerusalem, that ye stir not up, nor awake my love, until he please.
items.plainText: I charge you, O daughters of Jerusalem, that ye stir not up, nor awake my love, until he please.

items.text: Who is this that cometh up from the wilderness, leaning upon her beloved? I raised thee up under the apple tree: there thy mother brought thee forth: there she brought thee forth that bare thee.
items.plainText: Who is this that cometh up from the wilderness, leaning upon her beloved? I raised thee up under the apple tree: there thy mother brought thee forth: there she brought thee forth that bare thee.

items.text: Set me as a seal upon thine heart, as a seal upon thine arm: for love is strong as death; jealousy is cruel as the grave: the coals thereof are coals of fire, which hath a most vehement flame.
items.plainText: Set me as a seal upon thine heart, as a seal upon thine arm: for love is strong as death; jealousy is cruel as the grave: the coals thereof are coals of fire, which hath a most vehement flame.

items.text: Many waters cannot quench love, neither can the floods drown it: if a man would give all the substance of his house for love, it would utterly be contemned.
items.plainText: Many waters cannot quench love, neither can the floods drown it: if a man would give all the substance of his house for love, it would utterly be contemned.

items.text: We have a little sister, and she hath no breasts: what shall we do for our sister in the day when she shall be spoken for?
items.plainText: We have a little sister, and she hath no breasts: what shall we do for our sister in the day when she shall be spoken for?

items.text: If she be a wall, we will build upon her a palace of silver: and if she be a door, we will inclose her with boards of cedar.
items.plainText: If she be a wall, we will build upon her a palace of silver: and if she be a door, we will inclose her with boards of cedar.

items.text: I am a wall, and my breasts like towers: then was I in his eyes as one that found favour.
items.plainText: I am a wall, and my breasts like towers: then was I in his eyes as one that found favour.

items.text: Solomon had a vineyard at Baal-hamon; he let out the vineyard unto keepers; every one for the fruit thereof was to bring a thousand pieces of silver.
items.plainText: Solomon had a vineyard at Baal-hamon; he let out the vineyard unto keepers; every one for the fruit thereof was to bring a thousand pieces of silver.

items.text: My vineyard, which is mine, is before me: thou, O Solomon, must have a thousand, and those that keep the fruit thereof two hundred.
items.plainText: My vineyard, which is mine, is before me: thou, O Solomon, must have a thousand, and those that keep the fruit thereof two hundred.

items.text: Thou that dwellest in the gardens, the companions hearken to thy voice: cause me to hear it.
items.plainText: Thou that dwellest in the gardens, the companions hearken to thy voice: cause me to hear it.

items.text: Make haste, my beloved, and be thou like to a roe or to a young hart upon the mountains of spices.
items.plainText: Make haste, my beloved, and be thou like to a roe or to a young hart upon the mountains of spices.
